────────────────────────
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as central storage.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5).

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research.
• Electricity Groups at (x=3.5, y=22.5) and (x=-4.5, y=17.5).
• Steam Engines positioned at:
  – (x=-13.5, y=16.5)
  – (x=-14.5, y=13.5)
  – (x=7.5, y=35.5)
  – (x=8.5, y=20.5)
• Boiler Module:
  – Boiler at (x=12.0, y=20.5) intended for fluid production.
  – PipeGroup connection (fluid_system=158818, centered near (x=8.5, y=17.5)) linking the Boiler to the Steam Engine at (x=8.5, y=20.5).
   (Note: Connectivity warnings persist regarding liquid input and power network linkage.)

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine at (x=1.5, y=19.5) reconfigured for iron gear‑wheel production (status: NO_POWER).
• Burner Inserter at (x=1.5, y=17.5).
• Input Chest at (x=2.5, y=17.5).
• Output Chest at (x=1.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-5.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=0.5, y=17.5).
• Additional Burner Inserters at (x=2.5, y=16.5) and (x=3.5, y=17.5).
• Small Electric Pole at (x=5.5, y=19.5) for attempted power connection.

### Copper Extraction System (adjacent to the copper smelting furnace)
Consists of:
• Extraction Burner Inserter with pickup/drop positions around (x≈–3.5, y≈23.5).
• Buffer and Chest arrangements for copper ore handling.

### Extraction Belt Depot at position (x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5).
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=4.5, y=15.5).
• Depot Burner Inserter managing pick‐up and drop positions.

### Belt Connection Target Setup for Copper Extraction
Consists of:
• Extraction source (Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5)).
• Extraction Inserter at (x=4.5, y=15.5) feeding into a manual Transport Belt Chain.
• New Target Inserter at (x=8.5, y=9.5) guiding the belt chain.

### Remote Fluid Integration System at remote region (approximate center: x=-30, y=40)
Consists of:
• Offshore Pump at (x=-30.5, y=37.5) (WORKING).
• Boiler for fluid heating at (x=-29.0, y=33.5).
• PipeGroup connection carrying water (status: FULL_OUTPUT) with segmented connection remnants.

### Expanded Smelting Zone
Consists of:
• Stone Furnaces at (x=-20.0, y=22.0), (x=-20.0, y=25.0), and (x=-17.0, y=25.0).
• An intended furnace at (x=-17.0, y=22.0) that was not placed due to a blocking PipeGroup at (x=-17.5, y=21.5).
• Stone Furnace at (x=0.0, y=26.0) dedicated to copper smelting.

### New Network Structures
Consists of:
• Long‑distance Transport Belt Network spanning from (x=-3.5, y=10.5) to (x=22.5, y=10.5) (29 belts) for interzone material transfer.
• Copper Ore Transport Line (region x≈8–9, y≈11–15) comprising 6 belts carrying copper ore.
• Integrated Auxiliary Transport Network centered at (x≈3, y≈16) with connected Belt Groups (23 belts and 16 belts) for localized production supply.
• Short Belt Connector A (approximate location x≈–0.5 to –1.5, y≈20.5) linking adjacent factory sections (2 belts).
• Short Belt Connector B (around x≈–4.5 to –5.5) enhancing local connectivity (2 belts plus additional segments).

### Offshore Pump Water Supply Extension for Base Boiler at position (x=12.0, y=20.5)
Consists of:
• Offshore Pump at (x=-13.5, y=26.5) intended to supply water to the Boiler (status: NOT_CONNECTED; warning: no fluid present in connections).
• Offshore Pump at (x=1.5, y=32.5) intended to supply water to the Boiler (status: NOT_CONNECTED; warning: no fluid present in connections due to insufficient pipe resources).

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Crafting and Inventory Validation:
 – Verify availability of required sub‑ingredients and ensure crafting facilities are active before initiating complex crafts (e.g. iron‑plate for pipes and iron‑gear‑wheels for offshore pumps).
 – Confirm that the desired entity is present in inventory prior to placement actions.

• Placement and Proximity Considerations:
 – Ensure target placement locations fall within the allowable range; move closer if the distance exceeds limits.
 – Validate that candidate building areas are unobstructed and buildable; reattempt placement if the area is rejected or shows blockage.

• Connection and Resource Management:
 – Check that connection points between entities (such as between an offshore pump and a boiler) are unblocked and valid to ensure successful linking.
 – Confirm sufficient pipe resources are available before connecting systems; replenish resources if the required quantity (e.g. 30 pipes) is not met.

• Code and Variable Handling:
 – Use correctly defined variable names to avoid NameErrors (for example, ensure that variables like “placed_offshore” are defined before use).
 – Avoid calling non‑callable objects; verify that methods (such as candidate_area.center) are used with the proper object types and syntax.

• General Checks:
 – Review spatial constraints and resource inventories thoroughly before executing build or connection operations to reduce repetitive errors.
────────────────────────
